results.title: Carey Mulligan Won’t Let Hollywood Off the Hook
results.abstract: The actress delivered the performance of her career in the dark comedy “Promising Young Woman.” Then came those with their tired views of women.

multimedia.copyright: Danny Kasirye for The New York Times
multimedia.caption: Mulligan said of one review that focused on her looks: “I was like, ‘Really? For this film, you’re going to write something that is so transparent? Now? In 2020?’”

results.title: ‘Soul’ Features Pixar’s First Black Lead Character. Here’s How It Happened.
results.abstract: Mindful of animation’s history of racist imagery, the studio aimed to make the jazz pianist at the center of the film as specific as possible.

results.title: ‘Sylvie’s Love’ Review: In the Mood for Romance, Sighs and Tears
results.abstract: Tessa Thompson and Nnamdi Asomugha star in a swoony love story that wonderfully rethinks the classic Hollywood melodrama.

results.title: Patty Jenkins on ‘Wonder Woman 1984’ and the Future of Theaters
results.abstract: Jenkins made history with a lucrative deal to direct this sequel. With Warner Bros. opting to debut it on HBO Max, will she come back for a third film? “We’ll see.”

multimedia.caption: The director said of her difficult contract talks for this sequel: “I wanted to get paid at least as much as people who have done less well with their first superhero movies.”

results.abstract: The woman hasn’t had a hot meal in 15 years and she’s always cooped up at home. 2020 is the year to give this character from a classic holiday movie her due.
results.title: Can We Talk About the Mom in ‘A Christmas Story’?

results.title: Better Than Besties: Why Gay Holiday Films Matter
results.abstract: This season’s movies with queer characters may be a largely chaste affair, but their comforting formulas also tell L.G.B.T.Q. viewers that they are seen.
Members of the creative team discuss what it took to adapt the August Wilson play for Netflix and trying not to be “outdone” by the late actor.

results.title: ‘Soul’ Review: Pixar’s New Feature Gets Musical, and Metaphysical
results.abstract: This inventive tale stars Jamie Foxx as a jazz musician caught in a world that human souls pass through on their way into and out of life.

results.title: Barbara Windsor, Beloved British TV and Film Star, Dies at 83
results.abstract: She went from bubbly sex symbol in the “Carry On” films to working-class hero on “EastEnders.” Her private life was often as troubled as her “EastEnders” character’s.

results.title: Jeremy Bulloch, 75, Dies; Played Boba Fett in ‘Star Wars’ Movies
results.abstract: Mr. Bulloch said he based his performance as the menacing bounty hunter in part on Clint Eastwood’s performance as a laconic gunslinger.

results.title: Kim Ki-duk, Award-Winning South Korean Filmmaker, Dies at 59
results.abstract: He was celebrated for movies centered on society’s underbelly, but he was later accused of sexual misconduct. He died of Covid-19.

multimedia.caption: The South Korean filmmaker Kim Ki-duk in 2013 at the Venice Film Festival, where his “Moebius” was screened out of competition. A year earlier, his film “Pieta” had won the Golden Lion there.
